posts.cooked:
Some of you might have heard my request(s) for feature parity between the different clients before - and especially between the Android and iOS client. As some of you might also have noted that I‚Äôm a big fan of message trimming - which I use for iMessage and SMS. But since I‚Äôm using the iOS app I don‚Äôt have message trimming (and many other feature which the Android app already has implemented), which is even more annoying because 95% of my messaging I‚Äôm having in Signal. That is actually the way I want it to be, but I don‚Äôt want to care about it too much, i.e. that I‚Äôm running out of storage because the Signal database has gotten too big. (Wasn‚Äôt me, but my Mom‚Äôs got that problem which could be solved with message trimming. )

Maybe we could also talk about the famous missing backups for iOS (but maybe we should leave that for the dedicated thread ), or the differences in media sizes, which can be send, and all the other tiny differences.

But I‚Äôm kind of frustrated not to see any of this missing feature (which the Android app already got) coming to the iOS app, but things like little changes in the design of voice messages (speaking off the beta thread for the iOS app v. 5.42) which are the headline for the next update. Each time I see a new iOS beta thread I‚Äôm disappointed that none of these features have been implemented. Where are the other features for us? And there might be also examples which are vice versa - you Android users might tell us in this thread.

Maybe this is/was just a little rant and it won‚Äôt be the end of Signal for me, but in some way I‚Äôm getting tired of waiting - especially when I see that Android got a feature for two or three years and nothing happens on this side of the fence. Thanks for reading and your opinion.

I‚Äôm linking this comparison thread as well which hasn‚Äôt been updates in a while:

Feature Comparison: Android, iOS, Desktop Wiki
Lets start tracking features that differ across Signal versions. Please note that this is not a list of all existing features or feature requests! If you want the list of all feature requests, go ahead to this topic. Only include a feature below if it: has already been implemented on at least one platform and it is still missing on at least one other platform. Link to existing feature requests if possible. Meanings of statuses Status Meaning Feature available / i‚Ä¶

iOS Backups / Keeping message history when resetting phone

posts.name: anon53652
posts.cooked:
patjolata:

Maybe we could also talk about the famous missing backups for iOS

Indeed, I would be hard pressed to recommend Signal to anyone who cares about preserving his chats and insists on using iOS.

Especially now that the competition (read: WhatsApp) has rolled out chat transfer from iOS to Android and vice versa.

anon53652:

Indeed, I would be hard pressed to recommend Signal to anyone who cares about preserving his chats and insists on using iOS.

Yeah, while I don‚Äôt usually mind too much losing my chat history moving across devices, I‚Äôm learning that more people than I‚Äôd realize seem to consider this a deal breaker. This may be anecdotal, but now that I think of it, most of the people I‚Äôve talked to who call this a hard requirement have also been iOS users.

posts.name: anon53652
posts.cooked:
Turtle:

I‚Äôm learning that more people than I‚Äôd realize seem to consider this a deal breaker.

I would (I even maintain a Signal fork with extra backup options). Most of my communication with my GF who passed away last year was in Signal, I would feel very bad if I ever lost all that.

Turtle:

Yeah, while I don‚Äôt usually mind too much losing my chat history moving across devices

I don‚Äôt mind that much either. Also you can move the chats from one iOS to another iOS device.

Just as a reminder that I don‚Äôt want to discuss the missing backup functionality in iOS again in detail. This thread should be more about a general discussion about the missing feature parity.

Sorry, I overlooked that. Though, I don‚Äôt have much use for backups anyway

Looking over the comparison chart, I am wondering how many, if any, of the features missing from iOS are made more difficult to implement by Apple‚Äôs guidelines vs how many are a case of ‚Äúwe just haven‚Äôt gotten around to it yet,‚Äù as the ones missing from Android largely seem to be. I know the sms integration for iOS was discussed by some users years ago and a method to do it was thought up that I believe involved porting a number to Twilio? That part of the thread was half in jest, if I read correctly.

At any rate, message trimming seems one I would be curious to know the reason for not having.

Turtle:

Looking over the comparison chart, I am wondering how many, if any, of the features missing from iOS are made more difficult to implement by Apple‚Äôs guidelines vs how many are a case of ‚Äúwe just haven‚Äôt gotten around to it yet,‚Äù as the ones missing from Android largely seem to be.

Turtle:

At any rate, message trimming seems one I would be curious to know the reason for not having.

That are both good questions. I thought at one point they would implement new features in a way that they could use the code for both apps.

Turtle:

sms integration for iOS

SMS integration is not possible in iOS because Apple doesn‚Äôt allow other SMS apps except their own.
I thought at one point they would implement new features in a way that they could use the code for both apps.

Edit: And thanks @Herohtar for changing the category to a more fitting one.

posts.name: anon53652
posts.cooked:
patjolata:

SMS integration is not possible in iOS because Apple doesn‚Äôt allow other SMS apps except their own.

Is it not possible or not allowed for apps in the appstore? Would it be possible for an app in Cydia?

anon53652:

Is it not possible or not allowed for apps in the appstore? Would it be possible for an app in Cydia?

Without jailbreak, it‚Äôs not possible.
With jailbreak, everything is possible.

posts.cooked:
This commit mentions feature parity, but unfortunately in this case, rather, the lack of it

github.com/signalapp/Signal-iOS

Remove last TODO in RecipHidingManager

committed 06:55PM - 24 Oct 23 UTC
marissa-signal
+4 -2

A nice-to-have was to throw out the other user‚Äôs profile key if we‚Äôre not in a group with them. Product said this was not strictly necessary. Note that this is something that is done on Android, so there is a slight lack of parity here.

posts.name: Fabian
posts.cooked: Bringing this back up because this is something I believe is getting worse over time. New features are released, but yet feature parity isn‚Äôt achieved. If this isn‚Äôt worked on in the near future it will only get worse and worse over time.
